resources.string: This app helps you save WhatsApp status updates from your contacts. Below are some frequently asked questions to help you get started.
How do I save a status?

1. Open WhatsApp and view the status you want to save
2. Open Status Saver app
3. You'll see all recent statuses in the Images and Videos tabs
4. Tap the download button on any status to save it
5. Find saved statuses in your gallery under the Download/StatusSaver folder
Why does the app need permissions?

• Storage Permission: Required to access WhatsApp status files and save them to your device

• Media Permission: On Android 13+, needed to access and save images and videos

• Manage Storage Permission: On Android 11+, required to access WhatsApp status folder

We only use these permissions to provide the core functionality of saving statuses.
Why am I not seeing any statuses?

If you're not seeing statuses, check the following:

1. Make sure you've viewed the status in WhatsApp first
2. Verify all permissions are granted in Settings
3. For Android 11+, enable "Allow management of all files"
4. Check if you have WhatsApp or WhatsApp Business installed
5. Try pulling down to refresh the status list

Note: Statuses older than 24 hours won't appear in the app.
This app needs storage permission to access and save WhatsApp statuses
Android 10 and above requires special permission to access WhatsApp statuses. Please enable \"Allow management of all files\" in the next screen.
This app needs storage access to read WhatsApp statuses and save them. Please grant the permission to continue.
